entry.title: Everything You Need to Know About the SAP Young Professionals Program
entry.content:
If you’re an ambitious graduate looking to launch your tech consulting career, the SAP Young Professionals program might be the opportunity you’ve been waiting for! This free, immersive training experience opens doors to become an SAP Associate Consultant and kick-start your career among SAP's. 

What is the SAP Young Professionals program?

It is a free, 2-3 month intensive training initiative from the SAP Digital Skills Center that aims to equip recent university graduates (with less than 3 years of graduation) with SAP knowledge, soft skills, and certifications that prepare them for SAP consulting-related position within the EMEA region. 

Graduates are trained in SAP technologies such as: SAP S/4HANA , SAP Analytics Cloud ,  Artificial Intelligence , SAP Business Technology Platform , within others ((Modules may vary by cohort or region).

Who is eligible for the program?

Applicants typically need to meet the following criteria.

  • Hold a university degree (Bachelor’s or higher). 
  • Be a recent graduate (within the past 3 years).
  • Be currently unemployed or underemployed
  • Show strong English proficiency.
  • Be citizens or legal residents of the country where the program is being offered.

Note: Specific requirements may vary depending on country and region.

What does the program include?

Over the course of 2–3 months, participants will:

  • Earn globally recognized certifications 
  • Gain access to SAP Learning Hub and be trained by SAP specialists 
  • Develop soft skills
  • Have the possibility of starting your career as Associate Consultant in SAP's ecosystem (partners + customers)

Is the program really free?

Yes. The SAP Digital Skills Center delivers this program at no cost to participants as part of SAP’s mission to close the digital skills gap and support sustainable employment. SAP invests in rising talent to help drive digital transformation across industries.

Is employment guaranteed after completing the program?

While job placement is not guaranteed, one of the key goals of YPP is to connect graduates with SAP partners and customers who are actively hiring. Many graduates secure employment within the SAP ecosystem shortly after completing the program. However, success depends on the graduate's performance, certification results, and engagement throughout the course.

How to apply?

Applications are submitted via 👉  SAP Digital Skills Center portal.

Keep an eye on the website or SAP’s social media channels for announcements about new program cohorts in your region.

Written by Valentina Guevara.

entry.title: SAP BTP Developer’s Guide: Essential Best Practices from Setup to Scale
entry.content:
The SAP BTP Guidance Framework is your compass towards architecting, developing, and operating solutions on SAP BTP. It is the central access point for decision guides, reference architectures, methodologies, recommendations and DevOps principles. IT guides developers, administrators, architects, and partners with best practices along their journey.

This blog post focuses on the SAP BTP Developer’s Guide, which is a guided path for application development on SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP). As part of our blog series, we are diving into several topic areas to best help you navigate the framework. Refer to our first blog post for an introduction to the BTP Guidance Framework.

Who is the SAP BTP Developer’s Guide for?

The SAP BTP Developer’s Guide is embedded into the SAP BTP Guidance Framework and is dedicated to developers, architects, development project leads, and SAP partners. The guide supports each role to plan the application architecture, define the correct methodologies and tools, and select the right services. SAP partners can additionally use the guide to set up SAP BTP for developing and running applications and services for their customers.

What is it about?

The SAP BTP Developer’s Guide explains the building blocks for developing, delivering, and running business applications following the design-led development phases. As development projects for business applications have similar characteristics, this guide condenses best practices and technologies that can be safely recommended to you. The goal of the guide is to support you along the development process as a standardized development guidance and to drive developer efficiency.

 

 

ExploreIdentify the business opportunity and set up the roles and responsibilities in your team.
DiscoverIdentify required use cases and understand the end user holistically. Get familiar with the available technology and get to know use case patterns that can be implemented using SAP BTP. Explore the set of tools and services that allow you to keep the pace when developing applications and at the same time benefit from future innovations in SAP BTP.
Design

Design the user experience of your application to provide good usability. Use domain-driven design to create an application that is modularized and has shorter innovation cycles and a clearer focus. Before you begin developing your applications, make sure your landscape setup is appropriate for managing their lifecycles.

DeliverDevelop your application by following the recommendations for the respective programming model (CAP & ABAP Cloud), programming languages, development tools and consider aspects such as multitenancy, security, extensibility and others.
Run & Scale Get constant feedback from your users, optimize the application based on their feedback, and operate the application using the services and capabilities SAP BTP offers.

What’s next? - Continuous Development

The SAP BTP Developer’s Guide is a living document, and we are constantly updating and reassessing it. To get an overview about all the changes, we provide a dedicated page to show you what’s new for the BTP Developer's Guide in a comprehensive way.

The guide relies on your feedback which you can actively provide using GitHub. Prerequisite is that you are using the English version of the guide. Giving us feedback will get you in contact with the responsible authors of the SAP Help Portal pages and the development team to discuss documentation-related issues. To contribute to the BTP Developer’s Guide or to provide your feedback you have two options:

  • Click on Feedback > Create Issue: Provide feedback about a documentation page. This option opens an issue on GitHub.
  • Click on Feedback > Edit on GitHub: Contribute to a documentation page. This option opens a pull request on GitHub.

 

You can even comment directly in the guide when you have an SAP user and sign in.

To collaborate with us you can find more information here:

  • Contribution Guidelines
  • Introduction Video
  • Introduction Blog Post

With this we wish you successful application development.

For more resources explore the guidance framework or refer to the previous blog post: SAP BTP Guidance Framework Introduction. You can also stay tuned for the next blog post of the series covering the SAP Application Extension Methodology. 

Your SAP BTP Developer’s Guide Team

entry.title: Announcing the VNSG SAP BTP Hackathon
entry.content:
Following successful collaborations with SAP User Groups worldwide, we are pleased to announce that the SAP BTP Hackathon initiative is coming to the Netherlands. VNSG and SAP are partnering to host the first-ever VNSG SAP BTP Hackathon in the country

In a nutshell:

  • This event is open to all SAP customers, including both VNSG members and non-members
  • Customers can nominate a use case that demonstrates how they leverage SAP BTP capabilities to innovate and optimize their business processes
  • Coaches and the organization team will then select the participating teams to further develop their use case
  • Up to 3 finalists will showcase their solution during the Demo Jam at the VNSG and SAP annual event in March 2026, with the chance to win some cool prizes

Ronald Schippers, managing director of the VNSG, shared his thoughts on the event during preparation:

The VNSG SAP BTP Hackathon is the opportunity for our members to showcase their creativity and innovative strength through collaboration. It offers the chance to work together with SAP to transform innovative ideas into tangible solutions that make an impact — powered by SAP BTP.

At VNSG, our core values are “community” and “knowledge sharing.” That’s why this hackathon is not just about competition; it’s about building connections, fostering personal and professional growth, gaining new insights, and bringing innovation to life together — all while having a great time.

I warmly invite all our VNSG members to seize this opportunity: to innovate, to learn from SAP’s global and local experts, and to experience the true impact of innovation and community.

We can’t beat this intro, so we are not even going to try 😀

 

Details

SAP BTP is THE platform to integrate and extend SAP applications. In simple terms, if you were an artist, SAP BTP would be the colors and brushes you use to create your “masterpiece” or provide the needed “touch ups” to existing paintings, in a way that looks and feels as if the original artist had done it.

It’s used by customers, partners and SAP to innovate and optimize business processes while leveraging the latest and greatest cloud technology. From SAP Integration Suite to SAP Build to SAP HANA Cloud and everything in between, if your stakeholders have a question, SAP BTP is the answer.

The SAP BTP hackathon challenge will showcase how customers can use SAP BTP to adapt and optimize their business processes. But that’s not all!

Participants will also benefit from in-depth enablement sessions led by SAP product experts to help them through the ideation and build phases.

The participating customers, those who have had their use case selected for the SAP BTP hackathon, will also have access to expert coaches during their build phase. Coaches are there to make sure “no use case is left behind” 😉

Once the build phase is completed, customers will pitch their use case to a jury of SAP experts. The jury will choose 3 finalists based on different criteria, like business relevance, SAP BTP usage, innovation and vision, that will go on to demo their use case in front of a live audience at the annual VNSG and SAP event.

To show off your efforts, participating team members will get special badges added to their SAP Community profile. So, if you are not yet an SAP Community member, what are you waiting for?

 

To all NL SAP Customers

Don’t miss this unique opportunity to participate in the SAP BTP hackathon!

In short:

  1. Submit your use case 👉🏻 here by October 15
  2. (Selected customers) Build your prototype and prepare a short 5 to 10 min video including the business value, solution diagram and demo by December 10
  3. Get ready to pitch your demo in February 2026 in front of a panel of experts [exact dates to be confirmed]
  4. (Finalists) Compete in the Demo Jam in March 2026 at the VNSG and SAP annual event

In case you still need convincing, let me reiterate some of the perks:

  • Attend SAP BTP enablement sessions led by SAP experts for inspiration and knowledge.
  • Engage with the SAP ecosystem and get special badges to display on your profile. Don’t forget to create an account in the SAP Community
  • Get direct access to SAP BTP coaches to support you during your build phase.
  • Expand your SAP BTP knowledge and bridge the gap between business and IT.

In case you have any question on the event, please drop a comment below 👇🏻

 

Conclusion

Don’t be shy and join the fun. Brainstorm with your teams and bring your innovative ideas to life with SAP BTP 😉

entry.title: Release Navigator for SAP BTP - What's New in Q3 2025
entry.content:
The Release Navigator for SAP BTP continues to evolve and expand, offering our customers improved resources and streamlined access to product updates.

With the Q3 2025 update, we ensured all content is up-to-date and we are excited to announce the addition of a new product page for SAP Customer Data Solutions as well as some cosmetic UI updates. Read more about the details in this blog post.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Collaborating closely with SAP BTP experts, we've expanded the release coverage by introducing 11 new product pages. These pages compile links to all available release information, such as schedules, pre- and post-release communications, blogs, and more:

  • SAP Customer Data Solutions, including
    • SAP Customer Data Cloud / SAP Customer Identity and Access Management
    • SAP Customer Data Platform

Read on to see what you can find on this new page.

SAP Customer Data Solutions

This page contains specific resources for SAP Customer Identity and Access Management, SAP Customer Data Platform, as well as release resources relevant across different SAP Customer Data Solutions. Here’s a list of all you can find on this page:

  • SAP Customer Identity and Access Management (CDC)
    • Roadmap Explorer: Upcoming Innovations
    • What’s New Viewer: Release Notes
    • Customer Influence Campaign
    • SAP Community Tag
  • SAP Customer Data Platform
    • Roadmap Explorer: Upcoming Innovations
    • What’s New Viewer: Release Notes
    • Customer Influence Campaign
    • SAP Community Tag
  • General Customer Data Solutions Resources
    • SAP BTP Newsletter
    • Enablement Webcasts
    • Subscription link to Cloud Availability Center

Please Note: This page has previously been available via the Release Navigator for Customer Experience. Adding this page to the Release Navigator for SAP BTP reflects the move of SAP Customer Data Solutions from the Customer Experience area to SAP BTP. The page in the Release Navigator for Customer Experience will stay online until the beginning of Q4 2025 for everyone to take note and switch out their potential bookmarks or saved links. After that, only the page within the Release Navigator for SAP BTP will remain available.

Check it out.

 

 

With this last round of updates, we added new visual elements to all release navigators. The UI updates in the Release Navigator for SAP BTP do not affect functionality or performance and are strictly cosmetical.

On the home page also known as the Product Specific page, you will notice that our Welcome and Release Calendar cards have received a facelift for a fresher look and feel. 

On all pages where you can open informational text boxes by hovering over the lightbulb icon, you will see a slight update to the design of these boxes. Content and functionality remain the same. 

As a reminder: These pop-up boxes show up on every page with a lightbulb icon at the top and may be moved around on the page or closed once you are done reading them.

 

 

For centralized information regarding the release of new features for SAP BTP products and services, consult the Consolidated Release Schedule for SAP BTP.

Regarding the Release Navigator updates, refer to this update plan:

*Disclaimer: The schedule is subject to alterations without notice, including potential delays or the integration of changes in subsequent update windows. It doesn't establish a commitment, promise, or legal duty to deliver any material, code, or functionality. Looking into the remaining quarters of 2025, updates will focus on quarterly content maintenance and a steady extension of product coverage. No substantial UI updates are planned for the time being.

 

 

The Readiness@Scale team within SAP Enterprise Support is driven to ensure release readiness across the SAP Enterprise Support portfolio. Our mission is to empower SAP customers to effectively adopt and utilize innovations.

If you have feedback or specific requests for content within the release navigator, feel free to contact us.

Don't forget to explore our team’s blogs tagged under Readiness@Scale.

Happy navigating!

Readiness@Scale  
SAP Enterprise Support

entry.title: 🚀☁️ Migrating to SAP HANA Cloud: A Business Transformation Journey
entry.content:
About Me

Hare Krishna 🙏 I am an SAP BTP Cloud Architect sharing practical insights, solutions, and real-world experiences from the SAP ecosystem.

📝Introduction

In today’s fast-paced business environment, enterprises are under constant pressure to reduce costs 💰, accelerate innovation 🚀, and stay agile ⚡. Many organizations still run on-premise SAP HANA 🗄️ or ECC systems 🏢, which can limit scalability, slow analytics 📊, and increase IT overhead 🛠️.

Migrating to SAP HANA Cloud ☁️ offers a solution: a cloud-native, scalable, and intelligent platform 🤖 that not only modernizes your database but also unlocks new opportunities for business growth 📈, advanced analytics 📊, and AI-driven insights 🤖.

This blog explores the strategic advantages of moving to HANA Cloud, real-world scenarios, migration approaches, and how businesses can leverage this transformation for long-term success 🌟.

1. Why Businesses Should Care About Migration

SAP HANA on-premise has been the backbone of enterprise IT for over a decade. But today, companies face challenges like:

  • 💸Rising infrastructure and data center costs

  • 📉Difficulty scaling for seasonal or global demand

  • ⚡Pressure to innovate with real-time analytics and machine learning

SAP HANA Cloud is not just a database upgrade — it is a strategic enabler for business transformation:

  • ☁️Elastic scalability → pay only for what you use

  • 💰Lower TCO → no hardware refresh, no patching overhead

  • 🤖Built-in innovation → multi-model (graph, JSON, geospatial), ML integration, Datasphere

  • 🛡️ Cloud-grade resilience → HA, backups, encryption built in

👉For enterprises planning RISE with SAP, migration is often a key milestone. For GROW with SAP customers, HANA Cloud is already the default foundation.

2. A Real-World Story: Fashion Retailer Migrating During Peak Season

A large fashion retailer running ECC on HANA on-premise faced challenges during peak shopping seasons:

  • 🏬High traffic spikes during Black Friday, festive sales, and seasonal launches

  • 💾Hardware was over-provisioned to handle peak loads but under-utilized the rest of the year

  • 📊Analytics delays slowed decision-making for inventory replenishment, pricing, and promotions

By migrating to SAP HANA Cloud, the retailer was able to:

  • ☁️Scale compute resources elastically during high-demand weeks, then scale down during off-season

  • 📊Integrate sales, inventory, and supply chain data in SAP Datasphere for real-time visibility

  • 💰Reduce infrastructure costs by 25–30% while improving system performance

  • 🛒Optimize promotional planning and inventory allocation by leveraging faster analytics on HANA Cloud

👉Result: Smooth operations during peak shopping periods, lower costs, faster reporting, and improved customer satisfaction — all while creating a foundation for a future move to S/4HANA Cloud.

3.🛠️⚡ Migration Approach: Self-Service Tools for a Smooth Transition

Migrating to SAP HANA Cloud can be complex, but SAP provides self-service migration tools to simplify the process, reduce risk, and speed up implementation.

1️⃣Assessment & Planning

  • 🛠️ Review current HANA workloads, database size, and custom code.

  • 📝Decide whether to migrate using sidecar (DB only) or full migration.

  • 🔒Map compliance, security, and network requirements.

  • 📊Identify business processes to migrate first (e.g., analytics sandbox or critical ERP data).

👉Reference: SAP HANA Cloud Migration Guide

2️⃣Execution with SAP Self-Service Migration Tools

SAP HANA Cloud Migration Cockpit / DMO (Database Migration Option):

  • 🛠️ Self-service migration: Provides a guided, wizard-based process for migrating data from on-premise HANA or BTP HANA Service to HANA Cloud.

  • ⚡Supports multiple migration scenarios:

    • ECC on HANA → HANA Cloud (sidecar or full)

    • S/4HANA on-prem → HANA Cloud

    • SAP HANA Service on BTP CF → HANA Cloud

  • 🔄Automated delta replication: Keeps source and target databases in sync until cutover.

  • 🖥️ Validation & monitoring: Allows pre-checks, logs, and real-time monitoring of migration progress.

  • 🔗Seamless integration: Works with SAP tools like SLT/SDI, SUM/DMO, and SAP Cloud Transport.

Key Benefits:

  • Reduces manual steps and risk of errors.

  • Speeds up migration timeline.

  • Provides a self-service experience for IT teams, while still supporting SAP guidance and best practices.

👉Learning resource: SAP Learning Journey – Migrating SAP HANA to HANA Cloud

3️⃣Hands-On Simulation

  • 🖥️ Practice provisioning, configuring, and validating migration steps using SAP’s interactive simulation.

  • 👉Try it here: Enable Now Demo

4. Customer Scenarios: How Migration Helps Different Starting Points

🔹1. Customers on ECC on HANA (on-premise)

Current State:

  • 🗄️ Running legacy ECC (not yet S/4HANA) with an SAP HANA database on-premise

  • 💸Facing high infra + maintenance costs, limited innovation

How HANA Cloud Helps:

  • ☁️They can move their database layer first (sidecar or full migration) → reduce infra costs immediately

  • 🛠️ This becomes a stepping stone to RISE with SAP (moving ERP to S/4HANA Cloud later is easier if DB is already on HANA Cloud)

  • 📊Can use HANA Cloud for analytics scenarios while still keeping ECC running on-prem

Scenario Architecture:

[💻 Users/Apps]
      |
      v
+-------------------+        Initial Load          +---------------------+
| 🗄️ ECC (ABAP stack)|----------------------------->| ☁️ SAP HANA Cloud   |
+---------^---------+                              +----------^----------+
          |                                                 |
          |   Real-time Delta (SLT/SDI/DP Agent)            |
          +-----------------------------------------------> |
          |                                                 |
+---------+---------+                                       |
| 🗄️ SAP HANA (source)|<----- 🔗 VPN/Private Link/IPSec ---+
+-------------------+

👉Benefit: Lower TCO now, smoother path to S/4HANA in future

🔹2. Customers on S/4HANA On-Premise

Current State:

  • 🗄️ Already on S/4HANA, but hosted in on-premise data center

  • 💸Often invested in large HANA appliances sized for peak loads

How HANA Cloud Helps:

  • ☁️Lift & shift the database layer to HANA Cloud under RISE with SAP

  • ⚡Elastic scaling → no more overprovisioning

  • 📊Cloud-native features like multi-model DB and Datasphere integration unlock new business insights

  • 🛡️ Reduces IT overhead (patching, HA setup, backup) — handled by SAP

Scenario Architecture:

                +-------------------+
                | 🗄️ S/4HANA On-Prem |
                +---------^---------+
                          |  🛠️ DMO / Export-Import
                          |  + Optional continuous replication (SLT/SDI)
                          v
                 -------------------------- 🔗 Secure Network -------------------------
                          v
                +---------+---------+       +---------------------+      +-----------+
                | ☁️ SAP HANA Cloud  |<----->| 📊 SAP Datasphere   |<---->| 📊 SAC/BI |
                +---------^---------+       +----------^----------+      +-----^-----+
                          |                           |
                          | 🛠️ Destinations/XSUAA/CAP |
                          +---------------------------+

👉Benefit: Modernized infrastructure, cost savings, easier innovation, and alignment with SAP’s cloud-first roadmap

🔹3. Customers on SAP HANA Service on SAP BTP (Cloud Foundry)

Current State:

  • 🗄️ Using managed HANA instances in BTP CF, often for extension apps or analytics

  • ⚠️This service is being phased out in favor of HANA Cloud

How HANA Cloud Helps:

  • ☁️Migration ensures they’re on the strategic, supported database service

  • ⚡Feature parity and beyond (cloud-native scaling, multi-model)

  • 🛠️ Future-proof integration with BTP services like XSUAA, CAP, and Datasphere

Scenario Architecture:

 
+--------------------------------- BTP (CF) ---------------------------------+
|                                                                            |
|  +--------------------+           Data/Schema Move          +------------+ |
|  | 🗄️ HANA Service    |------------------------------------>| ☁️ HANA Cloud |
|  +---------^----------+                                     +-----^------+ |
|            | App Bindings (CAP/UI5/XSA)                      |             |
|            +----------------------------- Rebind/Retarget ---+             |
+----------------------------------------------------------------------------+

“Earlier SAP offered SAP HANA Service on BTP Cloud Foundry, but this has been fully retired and replaced by SAP HANA Cloud. Customers who were using HANA Service have already transitioned or are expected to migrate, since HANA Cloud is the only strategic database service supported by SAP.”

👉Benefit: Mandatory move for long-term support + added innovation opportunities

🔹4. Customers on Non-SAP Databases (Oracle, DB2, SQL Server) with ECC

Current State:

  • 🗄️ Legacy ECC on Oracle/DB2/SQL

  • 💸DB costs + performance issues

How HANA Cloud Helps:

  • ☁️Migrate directly to S/4HANA Cloud on HANA Cloud under RISE with SAP

  • ⚡Skip the intermediate step of on-prem HANA investment

  • 📊Immediately benefit from SAP’s innovation roadmap

Scenario Architecture:

[🗄️ Legacy ECC on Non-SAP DB] ---- Extract (ETL/LTMC) ---+
                                                        |
                                                        v
                                             +---------------------+
                                             | ☁️ S/4HANA Cloud    |
                                             +----------^----------+
                                                        |
                                             Standard Content & Mapping
                                                        |
                                                        v
                                             +---------------------+
                                             | ☁️ SAP HANA Cloud    |
                                             +---------------------+

👉Benefit: Leapfrog into cloud ERP without double investment

5. Migration Challenges & How to Overcome Them

While migrating to SAP HANA Cloud brings huge benefits, enterprises may face some challenges. Here’s what to watch for:

  • 🔄Data Volume & Delta Replication

    • Large datasets can slow migration.

    • Mitigation: Use SLT/SDI for incremental replication and pre-validate data mapping.

  • 🔐Security & Compliance

    • Sensitive business data needs encryption in transit and proper role mapping.

    • Mitigation: Configure VPN/Private Link, enforce identity/auth with XSUAA, and follow SAP security guidelines.

  • 🛠️ Custom ABAP Code & Extensions

    • Custom programs may have compatibility issues with HANA Cloud.

    • Mitigation: Test custom code in sandbox or trial HANA Cloud before cutover.

  • ⚡Application & Integration Dependencies

    • Connected apps or BI tools need retargeting.

    • Mitigation: Rebind or redirect connections to HANA Cloud and Datasphere endpoints.

  • ⏱️ Downtime & Cutover Planning

    • Minimizing business disruption is critical.

    • Mitigation: Plan cutover during off-peak periods, validate all delta loads, and communicate with stakeholders.

6. How This Fits with RISE & GROW with SAP

  • 🌟RISE with SAP → Migration is a natural step for existing ERP customers moving to S/4HANA Cloud

  • 🌱GROW with SAP → Net-new cloud ERP customers start directly on HANA Cloud and benefit from innovation immediately

7. Business Outcomes After Migration

  • 💰30–40% lower infrastructure costs

  • ⚡Faster innovation cycles with ML, JSON, graph, and Datasphere integration

  • 🌐Global reach through geo-replication

  • 🛡️ Operational resilience with automated HA and backups

8. Future Roadmap / Innovation After Migration

After migration, enterprises can unlock new business capabilities on HANA Cloud:

  • 🤖Machine Learning & Predictive Analytics

    • Forecast demand, optimize inventory, and personalize offers in retail.

  • 🌐Real-Time Data Integration with Datasphere

    • Connect multiple cloud and on-premise sources for unified analytics.

  • ⚡Cloud-Native Applications

    • Build extensions using SAP CAP, integrate with Fiori/UI5 apps, and leverage BTP services.

  • 🛠️ Automation & RPA

    • Automate repetitive processes and alerts for faster operational response.

  • 🚀Future-Ready ERP

    • Smooth path to S/4HANA Cloud or advanced SAP solutions under RISE with SAP.

Key Takeaways

  • 🚀Migration to SAP HANA Cloud is strategic, not just technical

  • 🛠️ Start with analytics or sandbox workloads first

  • 🖥️ Use SAP guides + Enable Now simulation to de-risk projects

  • 🌟Align migration with your RISE roadmap for long-term gains

entry.title: UPDATE: SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud Availability via SAP Business Data Cloud
entry.content:
After the announcement on July 1st regarding the availability of SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud (public option) via SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC), the reaction was of great excitement and interest in learning more about the next steps especially about the tenant rewiring option to move existing tenants to SAP BDC. If you missed the announcement, you could read it here: Announcement: SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud - SAP Community

The objective of this blog is to share with you the latest information about the tenant rewiring and what it involves.

First, what does it mean for an SAP Datasphere or SAP Analytics Cloud to be rewired?

A tenant rewiring does not mean artefacts or data migration, it mainly refers to the consumption approach (from a commercial model perspective) of these services, and to the customer facing tool to manage the tenant lifecycles (via SAP for Me).  The tenant itself will remain the same, and the URL of the current tenants will not change either. In addition, there are no additional charges for rewiring an SAP Datasphere or SAP Analytics Cloud tenant to SAP BDC.

Second, how will the tenant rewiring work?

There are two paths for customers when it comes to how the tenant rewiring will work.

Customers may have started their consumption of SAP Datasphere or SAP Analytics Cloud (public option) via one of the following consumption models:

  • A subscription of the services where the tenants are provisioned and managed by SAP
  • A subscription of the services where the tenants are provisioned self-service by customers via the customers SAP BTP Global Accounts.

The tenant rewiring tool will support both models; however, the way the process is triggered will be different.

For the SAP-managed / provisioned tenants, the tenant rewiring will be initiated automatically as soon as you update your subscription with SAP (via your SAP account team) to move your subscription from the standalone product subscription to the SAP BDC subscription. This means that the tenant rewiring will be initiated as part of your subscription change request, and the tenant will automatically move to SAP BDC.

When you have a new subscription to SAP BDC, you will receive an email notification from SAP to log into your SAP for Me account. You will need to activate your BDC cockpit in your appropriate data center. If these steps are done prior to the tenant rewiring process, you will be able to see the rewired tenants in your BDC formation as soon as the process is completed.

NOTE: You must use the same hyperscaler and the same data center for your BDC cockpit as your current standalone subscription. The tenant rewiring tool does not migrate tenants between hyperscalers or data centers.

It is important to mention that the tenant will be available for your end users during the process and there is no tenant downtime required by the tenant rewiring tool.

For the tenants that are provisioned self-service via the customers SAP BTP Global Account, your admin will be able to initiate the tenant rewiring directly via the BTP Global Account, also self-service. The only pre-condition required is that a BDC subscription must pre-exist before triggering the tenant rewiring process to move the tenant to SAP BDC.

The steps are as follows:

  • BTP Admin goes in the BTP Global Account / BTP cockpit and updates the BTP Service instance related to the tenant
  • The request is received by SAP and the process is initiated to update the tenant and move it to BDC
  • Login to SAP for Me and, login to BDC, go to the resources tab where you will be able to find the rewired tenants under “bdc-rewired” resource group.
  • Once the rewiring is completed, the tenant will be visible in BDC

Overall, the tenants are preserved and now will be consumed via SAP BDC.

For more information and step-by-step, visit the tenant rewiring documentation.

SAP Analytics Cloud in this blog refers to the following:

  • SAP Analytics Cloud for business intelligence, public system option
  • SAP Analytics Cloud for planning, standard edition, public system option

entry.title: Introducing the Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt 🔨🪙 ... COMING SOON
entry.content:
Welcome to the Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt, a chase around important SAP developer-related tools/sites, a challenge to construct a secret phrase, and a chance to win 1000s of points toward the Devtoberfest grand prize.

The hunt officially starts Sept. 25, with the release of the first clue during that day's SAP Developer News, and you have until the end of Devtoberfest, Oct. 24, to complete it.

To get all the clues make sure to SUBSCRIBE TO THIS POST!!

Learn more about the  entire Devtoberfest event in @KevinR's post Devtoberfest 2025 Welcome!.

What you need to find

We have hidden a special phrase, which you need to figure out using the clues from several missions, described in the next section. Along your journey you will do the following:

  1. Visit about 10 different locations related to SAP developers, mostly web sites that are designed to help you in your daily SAP development.
  2. At each location, you will discover a set of hexadecimal digits.
  3. Concatenate the digits together (in the order of the missions) to get one, 37-digit hexadecimal number.
  4. Multiply that hexadecimal number by another secret number, for which we will give a clue.
  5. Take the resulting 38-digit hexadecimal product, and convert it into the secret phrase, using each pair of digits as values for ASCII characters.
  6. Enter the phrase, exactly (case-sensitive, no extra spaces), into the Scavenger Hunt tutorial.‌

Not until the SAP Developer News of Oct. 16 will you have all the pieces to be able to complete the phrase. 

Example Hunt

As an example of what you will have to do, here's a short sample hunt (just a warm-up, no points will be earned). Each mission is independent of the other.

MissionNo. DigitsSAP Web PropertyInstructions
17

SAP Developers YouTube Channel

Go to our SAP Developer YouTube channel. 

Open @Rekha_DR's video "SAP Build Process Automation (Part 1): Build your very first process". Watch it and find the secret 7-digit hexadecimal number in one of the info cards.

You can also see the hex digits in the description.

26SAP Community

Inside this blog post, use the Developer Tools on your browser to inspect the words "SAP Community" in the cell immediately to the left (in this this very table) and find the 6-digit RGB ASCII code for the color of the text. 

3None (directly) 

Concatenate the 2 sets of hexadecimal digits (13 in all), in order, and multiply the resulting hexadecimal number by the number of original SAP founders (you can easily find the number on the SAP Wikipedia page).

Convert the resulting hexadecimal number into a phrase, converting each pair of digits into a character using ASCII codes.

👉Post a comment/picture about the phrase -- but NOT the phrase itself  (like your experiences with or opinion about the phrase, or a picture of something belonging to you that reminds you of the phrase) -- you won't get any points, but it will be fun and you will be ready for the real scavenger hunt. If you have any trouble with this example hunt, post in the comments.

REMINDER: The above is just an example of how the real scavenger hunt will work. The real scavenger hunt instructions will be described in the rest of this blog post, as clues become available.

 

The (real) hunt

Below are the instructions for finding the hexadecimal digits for the actual scavenger hunt. We will release clues as follows:

  • In the SAP Developer News of Sept. 25, Oct. 2, Oct. 9, and Oct. 16.
  • In this blog each Monday during the first 3 weeks of Devtoberfest.

👉To be notified when a new clue is released, SUBSCRIBE TO THIS POST!!

‌ When you find the secret phase, just enter it into this Devtoberfest tutorial.

To guide you, we have created a second tutorial -- you do not have to use it, nor do you get any points from it. But you can enter the 1 to 6 digits from each mission to check if you received the correct digits for that mission.

Here are your missions 

MissionNo. DigitsSAP Web PropertyInstructions
12

SAP Developer News

The Developer News comes out each Thursday with the latest about ABAP, CAP, BTP, SAP Build, UI5, Fiori, AI, and all your favorite SAP developer topics. All delivered by some of your favorite Developer Advocates, like DJ, Shilpa Shankar, Thomas Jung, Antonio Maradiaga, Nora von Thenen and the rest of the gang.

Most episodes about 5 minutes. Also available as a Podcast.

Watch the Developer News of Sept. 25
26 To be released Sept. 29
34 To be released Sept. 29
42 Watch the Developer News of Oct. 2
54 To be released Oct. 6
66 To be released Oct. 6
76 Watch the Developer News of Oct. 9
86 To be released Oct. 13
91 To be released Oct. 13
10None (directly) Watch the Developer News of Oct. 16

Good luck!

😸

entry.title: SAP Datasphere News in August
entry.content:
SAP Datasphere News in August

Another month with two nice new release deliveries ✨

Learn more in my short top features video in August 2025 on YouTube 📺

In addition, explore the latest updates in our community news blogs and more.

 

 

My top features in August

 

Transformation Flow: Processing in Batches

You can now break down large transformation flow datasets into batches to avoid out-of-memory (OOM) errors when using the SAP HANA runtime in Datasphere. Defining batches on transformation flows enhances the performance and reliability, while ensuring efficient data integration and processing.

You find this feature in the data integration monitor as it is part of the runtime settings under the Batches tab. Simply pick a suitable column and define the batch sizes in number or records. You can also define to use it only for a large initial load or both initial and delta loads.

➡️  More information.

 

New source and targets for Replication Flows

Microsoft OneLake as a Source for Your Replication Flow

You can now use Microsoft OneLake—which was formerly also known as Azure Data Lake Generation 2—, and the corresponding connection type to add sources to replication flows and replicate data in CSV format from the source for initial loads.

➡️  More information.

  • Cloud Storage Provider Sources
  • Microsoft OneLake Connections

 

SAP Signavio as Target for Your Replication Flows

You can now use connection type SAP Signavio and replication flows to load data from SAP source systems, such as SAP S/4HANA and others, into SAP Signavio as target system. This allows an efficient and scalable data replication into the SAP Signavio solution.

➡️  More information.

  • SAP Signavio Targets
  • SAP Signavio Connections

 

SAP Analytics Cloud, add-in for Microsoft Excel

There is a very nice feature new in SAP Analytics Cloud, which I think is super useful for many of you. With the QRC 3 release, you can transfer a table from an SAC story to Excel and further use it with the add-in. In Excel, the transferred table is based on the same data source, for example Datasphere, and has the same navigation state (dimensions, measures in rows and columns, filters, and variables). The idea is to benefit from native Excel capabilities on Datasphere data in real time. You can adjust the report, add custom functions on top of the table, and more.

➡️  More information.

 



SAP Business Data Cloud Getting Started Series

 

Starting September 10, the Getting Started Series kicks off with three modules

  • Module 1: Build an Intelligent Application Grounded in Data Products (Sep 10, 2025)
  • Module 2: Fuel AI Innovation with SAP Databricks in Business Data Cloud (Sep 24, 2025)
  • Module 3: Create and Enrich an Analytical Model with SAP Datasphere (Oct 8, 2025)

👉  Sign up today on the registration page.

➡️  Step-By-Step Guide: Getting started with the SAP Business Data Cloud Basic Trial

 

Learning Update

Our learning colleagues are currently defining a brand new course: Becoming an SAP Data Architect.

You will learn:

🔹How Data Architecture enables efficiency, innovation, and measurable business outcomes

🔹 Ways to communicate complex data concepts clearly — to both technical and non-technical stakeholders

🔹 How to identify and prioritize opportunities, build business cases, and articulate value

🔹 Techniques for designing target-state architectures aligned with SAP Business Data Cloud, SAP Analytics Cloud, and SAP Datasphere

🔹 Storytelling methods to overcome resistance and foster adoption of data-driven change

 

This course is the first step in a learning path:

✅  Start with the free “Becoming an SAP Data Architect” course in November 2025

✅  Continue with a free advanced course coming early 2026

🏆  Together, they prepare you for a brand-new SAP Data Architect certification in 2026

 

My favorite blogs in August

 

Use SAP Business Data Cloud Capacity Estimator

There is a great blog series about the capacity estimator SAP Business Data Cloud, which of course also includes the SAP Datasphere estimator by @FernandaFroelich. Not all blogs are published yet as the series is work in progress, but already a great start:

  1. Learn How to use SAP Business Data Cloud Capacity Unit Estimator?
  2. Explore How to edit a quota assignment in SAP Business Data Cloud?
  3. Use the Capacity Unit Estimator across SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Datasphere, and SAP Databricks. 

 

SAP Business Data Cloud rewiring of existing Datasphere and SAC tenants

My dear colleague @Ammar_Naji has updated his blog on the rewiring option for existing SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud tenants. Very informative and includes all the steps which need to be done.

➡️  UPDATE: SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud Availability via SAP Business Data Cloud

 

Open Resource Directory

This is a must read for all SAP Business Data Cloud experts out there:
➡️  Why we created Open Resource Discovery

The Open Resource Discovery (ORD) is the core protocol for application / service metadata publishing and discovery within SAP Business Data Cloud. This blog written by @SimonHeimler explains the concepts behind the scenes and gives you links to resources where you find further details.

 

SAP Datasphere SQL Navigator browser plugin

SAP Mentor and active community member @kostertim has created a very useful browser plugin to be able to navigate from one SQL view to another by just highlighting the view and using a hotkey combination or browser context menu—avoiding a lot of copy-and-paste efforts. All is described in his blog ➡️  DSP SQL Navigator – Stop copy pasting URLs! And of course the YouTube video:
